name: Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
Reference Documents: Drawings and drawing registers
Record of conformity: This ITP signed off
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity: This ITP signed off
Acceptance Criteria: Bedding sand provided over rock and above conduit
Record of conformity: This ITP signed, Recievable Inspection checklist

Acceptance Criteria: Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all works will meet level and location requirements. The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and set out activity. IFC and latest available revision used.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Superintendent to inspect completed tench
• Where conduits are laid under carriageway pavements, the minimum cover from top of conduit to the pavement surface shall be 600 mm
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Frequency: Prior to installation of conduits

Acceptance Criteria: All conduit installation works for electrical wiring and communications cabling shall be carried out by, or under the direct supervision of, appropriately registered and licensed personnel
Record of conformity: This ITP signed, Subcontractor competencies on salesforce
Acceptance Criteria: Place and Compact fill in no greater than 300mm layers
– minimum 300mm 20mm Class 3 FCR below pavement/ground level
– Where trench passes under load bearing zones maximum 200mm layers
– conduits under area to be paved backfilled with select back fill to subgrade level
– conduits under area not to be paved backfilled with select fill to 0.4m above top of conduit and common back fill above that
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Superintendent to inspect testing and compaction of subgrade
• Post compaction falling cone penetrometer >7 blows per 300mm
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Frequency: Once, prior to use of backfill >40mm
Acceptance Criteria: Detailed proposals for the compaction of backfill materials of nominal size greater than 40 mm shall be submitted to the superintendent for review before commencing work.
Record of conformity: Correspondence with superintendent

Acceptance Criteria: Marker tape is to be installed  above each line of conduits in all trenches where electrical and communications conduits are provided. When constructed in a shared trench, it must be ensured that the electrical warning tape is on top.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Cable pits constructed and installed as per drawings
• Reinforced concrete apron installed around pits that are in an unsealed area
• Heavy pit lid provided where pit is located in a road pavement
• All pits, junction boxes or terminal pits for electrical purposes shall be watertight
• Pits shall be constructed such that the level of the top of the pit lid matches surrounding finished surface level, top of pit wall is finished so that lid fits without movement
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Surplus excavated material shall be removed from site. All affected areas shall be restored to similar conditions that existed prior to work.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Installed location and depth of conduits, and location of pits and pedestals, shall be accurately recorded on as-constructed drawings.
• Lot Maps shall be completed to show the extent of works for each lot.
Record of conformity: As Built Drawing
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
